intro: Gleichenia dicarpa var. longipinnata, commonly known as the long-pinnate spikemoss, is a member of the family Huperjiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. It features a creeping rhizome with erect, branching stems covered in lanceolate, dark green leaves. The leaves are typically arranged in two ranks, with the upper leaves being longer and more slender, giving the plant its distinctive long-pinnate appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or along stream banks. This variant is noted for its ecological importance in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for microorganisms.
